recommendations.name: 1935 Cactus Garden
recommendations.description: The 1935 Cactus Garden is behind the Balboa Park Club and Puppet theater. It is a great little cactus garden full of some pretty big examples of slow growing cactus. There is a nice patio area with an my favorite aspect of this place: the chill vibes from the freeway below and the awesome views of the bridge across the way.

recommendations.name: Lifeguard Palapa
recommendations.description: At some point somebody tied a satallite dish up on poles, put some palm fronds on top and called it a palapa. The view from here is spectacular, an excellent location to have coffee and watch surfers in the morning, or just mellow out at sunset. Getting down can be most of the trouble, but there is parking near the corner of Blackgold Rd. and La Jolla Farms Rd. Take the paved road down to the beach and walk north for just a few minutes. You'll see it up a short trail above a wider section of the beach.
links.name: Black's Beach

recommendations.name: Rick Lyon
recommendations.description: In the depths of the Imperial House, a legend plays a Casio keyboard. With resplendant hair, and even more resplendant chest hair, Lyon plays the best of oldies, 70's, 80's and today. You'll be treated to the Imperial House's usual dark wood and leather, nary a window to be seen. The experience is a little surreal. Highly recommended
recommendations.noise: midi drum tracks, tickled ivories and sumptuous vocals
links.name: Imperial House Restaurant
